snippet: In the British theater a production of one celebrated title by no means precludes another following hot on its heels. Sometimes the one seems almost to be stalking the other. But how much is too much, even of a good thing?
abstract: In the British theater a production of one celebrated title by no means precludes another following hot on its heels. Sometimes the one seems almost to be stalking the other. But how much is too much, even of a good thing?

headline.main: Chekhov Again? 'Uncle Vanya' and the Instant Replay
